I'm going to have to agree with Jinsoo. I'm presently
taking a College level Japanese course. I swear to god
they make absolutely beautiful blades and fittings but
SHIT they need to stick to one method of numbering and
grammar rules. And to truely learn Japanese you have
to learn Romanji, Hirigana, Katagana, and Kanji so
that's four different languages in one. Oh yea and
things that are flat are counted differently than
those that are round. What the Hell is up with that?!?
Best advice get a tutor.

Bob R

--- Jinsoo Kim <jinsoo.kim@...> wrote:
> Richard,
> 
> Find the private tutor. That will be the best for
> you. As Japanese 
> grammar is completely different from English, it
> will blow out your 
> head. Nice tutor will guide you much better and can
> amplify your 
> interest about this field.
> 
> Jinsoo
> 
>
